title: KYPO Cyber Range Training Demo Content

levels.title: How to connect to the sandbox
levels.content: Info about accessing the game level was moved to the game level.

levels.title: Connecting Via Telnet
levels.content:
Your task in this simple level is to connect to the server via **`telnet`** on port **`2323`** using **`test:password`** and get the flag.

## GUI access
1. In the topology overview, click the button in the top-right corner of the graph, then **`Expand All`**, **`client`** and **`Generate console URL`**. After a few moments, **`Open link`** next to the **`Generate console URL`** should appear.

2. Login using username **`kypo`** and password **`kypo`** for root access.

## SSH from local machine
1. Use the **`Get SSH Access`** button to download **`ssh-access.zip`**.

2. Extract the **`ssh-access.zip`** file to the **`~/.ssh/`** directory.

    ```shell
    $ unzip ssh-access.zip -d ~/.ssh/
    ```

    You will get following files:
    
    ```shell
    ~/.ssh/pool-id-<pool_ID>-sandbox-id-<sbx_ID>-user-config - The SSH configuration file.
    ~/.ssh/pool-id-<pool_ID>-sandbox-id-<sbx_ID>-user-source.sh - The configuration  script.
    ~/.ssh/pool-id-<pool_ID>-sandbox-id-<sbx_ID>-user-key - The sandbox user SSH private key.
    ~/.ssh/pool-id-<pool_ID>-sandbox-id-<sbx_ID>-user-key.pub - The sandbox user SSH public key.
    ```

3. Execute the extracted source script in the current shell using the **`source`** command with the path to the KYPO proxy SSH private key. The source script that will set the **`ssh`** command and the **KYPO proxy SSH private key**, which is available to instance operator.

    ```shell
    $ source ~/.ssh/pool-id-<pool_ID>-sandbox-id-<sbx_ID>-user-source.sh PATH_TO_KYPO_PROXY_PRIVATE_KEY
    ```

4. Connect to the client to **`kypo`** user. 

    ```shell
    $ ssh kypo@client
    ```
levels.solution:
1. To connect to the server use command **` telnet server 2323`**, then enter username **`test`** and password **`password`**.

2. Get the flag using **`cat flag.txt`** and submit it.

hints.title: Correct Command
hints.content: Use `telnet server 2323` and enter username and password to connect.

hints.title: Port Number
hints.content: The server is listening at port `2323`.
